reviews.text: Came here with a few friends. We enjoyed all the food! Love the cozy atmosphere and the staff were polite and very helpful. I'd like to come back and try a few more of their dishes next time!

It is a pub and I really enjoy the English (irish) pub ambience and looks of this place. Not all the dishes are great but the fish & chip is to die for. Fresh tasting fish on light crispy beer battered. The portion is big too. The mushy pea is yummy.  A lot of draft beer to choose from and their monthly beer of the month promo is pretty good priced. On top of it all, all the prices are nett and the prices are reasonable. This is my regular haunt. üòÄ

Nice quiet chill laid back place and ambiance. Just dropped by for a quick drink and snack..the staff was really pleasant I must highlight, spoke in sucha hospitality manner it's like voice one hears on the radio. Haha. Comfy informal in a formal way still. Spice bag on the menu caught our eye and it was really gd light munch over drinks!

We went there to celebrate friday night and vibe was so good as well the staff. We could spend some us time there. Food was excellent and we enjoyed happy hour for wine. Tried potato wedges, spicy chicken drumlets, red shiraz wine, beer and one of their desserts which was based on mars. We loooved chicken which was in perfect spicy level for us. And this dessert was yummyü´∂üèª great pub to spend the weekend

A very nice place to go for good food,  service and chill out.

Been here a few times and never been disappointed by the service and the food.  Very yummy food and of course good beer for those who are beer lovers.

Rather quiet at lunch and afternoon but a little pack at dinner and weekends.  Overall,  a recommended place to go if you are near the area.  Parking is limited right at the venue but you can find parking a little further,  need walking but manageable.
